website_summaries.verdict: Gorgeous pour-over coffee maker for coffee drinkers who prefer to make smaller batches.
pros: Charming wood collar and leather tie
Quality non-porous glass does not absorb odors
Suitable for a single person or a couple
cons: It only has capacity for 3.5 cups, which is only a concern for those who want to make larger portions at a time

customer_reviews.title: It is warping?
customer_reviews.text: How could this be happening? Weak glass somehow? Counterfeit that is really some kind of plastic? I am no stranger to chemex. I don't get it. This happened after a month of usage. Bought it as a gift to my girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It boils down to good beans and roast and some intuition. This item will help you with the latter.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. It's all in the maker's hands. Total control over coffee quality! You cannot get that control via a conventional coffee maker. If you purchase a water heater with a goose neck that controls the temperature this is perfect (right temperature and your way of pouring water over the grounds). Alone the fact that gives you individuality to make your coffee is worth it. Only for geeks of course ;) If you simply want a decent quick coffee then a Mr. Coffee might do the trick for you already. In the end it's the beans and the roast that are most important. The rest boils down to (ha) intuition and believing in the process.
customer_reviews.author: DerAusgewanderte

customer_reviews.title: Good glass, but wood collar doesn't fit exactly
customer_reviews.text: The glass is well shaped, and with the Chemex filters, makes a great cup of coffee. The wood collar on this one is not shaped well, and is a sloppy fit over the neck of the glass, unfortunately, and so it rattles around a bit when you pick it up by the collar to move the hot glass around. (And yes, I've got it on correctly.) I've had the larger Chemex for years, and its collar fits perfectly, so maybe this was a one-off problem?
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, but alternatives are better
customer_reviews.text: This thing has an excellent reputation, and it does make good coffee - but I think it's more cosmetic than function. Two complaints: 1) if you regularly rinse this thing, you have to take off the wood and leather part - it will grow mold if its stays moist. 2) the price of the Chemex is good, but the filters are not. There are Chemex alternatives here on Amazon that are similarly priced, and solve these two issues, with the same coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Acyl

customer_reviews.title: Best pour-over maker around!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Chemex, it’s all I use now and is perfect for one person. Great flavor and much cleaner that a French press. I think it’s smoother too. If you haven’t tried a pour over and you call yourself a coffee lover your missing out!!
customer_reviews.author: Nate EP

customer_reviews.title: This Chemex pour over coffee maker is too small,
customer_reviews.text: Have been using Chemex coffee makers for 40 years, the 1 to 3 cup is too small, coffee grounds often end up in the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Best way to brew two cups of coffee
customer_reviews.text: For two cups of great coffee, this is the way to go. I use a cordless tea kettle to boil water, fresh ground coffee beans and folded filters to make 15 oz's of coffee that I put in my YETI cup and enjoy hot coffee for up to two hours. Clean up is simple. Just rinse with water. Caution: these are very breakable and shatter into many pieces. I know from personal experience. Don't drop them and you will do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL UNDERWOOD

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend as gift unless inspecting first as box was in bad shape
customer_reviews.text: The actual product is very cute and easy to hold. The box it came in though looked bent and broken down like someone had owned this before and returned it. I don’t mind except that I purchased the product as “New” so I also paid full price. Just means I will be sanitizing this one a little more thoroughly before using and would NOT recommend sending as a gift unless you inspect it first. Was also sent USPS so it took allot longer to arrive :/
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Karlskin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite way to make coffee
customer_reviews.text: I once used a drip machine, then I used an AeroPress, then I used a Nespresso machine, then I used a French press, then I used a moka pot, and now I use a Chemex. Every different brewing method has its pros and cons, but when it comes to the best tasting and cleanest cup of coffee that's also the most hassle-free way to make, the Chemex is by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: I really don’t recommenced
customer_reviews.text: i really loved this size but after a while of using the glass color started to change and get darker instead of clear!! Also the bamboo handle is pretty loose
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE, JUST STARTED USING THIS
customer_reviews.text: VERY NICE, JUST STARTED USING THIS. COFFEE TASTED GREAT. NOT BITTER. BOUGHT THE BRUSH, AND BE CAREFUL WHICH FILTERS YOU ORDER FOR THIS THE RIGHT ONES ARE CHEMEX HALF CIRCLE FILTERS FP-2. AMAZON LINKED THE WRONG FILTERS TO THIS COFFEE POT, I THEN ORDERED THE RIGHT ONES FROM CHEMEX.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee -- Filters Overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: This product makes excellent coffee. It seems like they have the correct angle so the water hits all the grounds. BUY THE 6 CUP. The 3 cup is unstable. It will fall over and break. Then you will buy the 6 cup. The 6 cup is thicker and holds heat better. It also has a better ring for the stove. The big drawback are the filters. THEY ARE TOO EXPENSIVE at $0.10 per use. I am reusing filters two or three times. Reminds me of razor refills. I did try other filters, but they did not work as well or would drop into the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Mighty Wolverine

customer_reviews.title: The filters taste like...
customer_reviews.text: It's not about their carafe; it's about their filters. There are none better and few as good. I dislike the taste of paper in my coffee, whether from a filter or a cup. So, I use a top-quality paper filter is healthier, cleaner, and contributes no taste of its own. It's also nice that the carafe attractive and easy to use. I generally prefer nondecafinated coffee. Rick murkyvista.blogspot.com
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect coffee dripper for 1-2 people. I purchase this as a gift item and I was afraid that it was going to be too small but it is still a really good size that will give two to three cups of coffee. I was also a little afraid that the product might break in shipping because it is made of a thin glass but the glass was actually thicker than I thought and remained in one piece. I highly recommend this to anyone who doesn't have a coffee maker and Lakes a few cups of coffee in the morning. Very easy to use. Make sure you get the correct size filters which are also sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sydni Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Chemex Beginner Here
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use! This is perfect for someone who is living by themselves and only drinks one or two cups of coffee in the morning. I have used many different beans and every cup has been great so far. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Makes a delicious cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to another method for brewing coffee. It brews the perfect cup - strong and delicious. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is it is fragile and I've had to replace one after cracking the first one. Be careful with it and never put it in the dishwasher, just rinse it out with hot water. This is perfect for one person (it brews about 2 big cups of coffee) or 2 people who drink one cup each.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey M.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, this has changed how I make my coffee. I have used an electric drip for years and tried other drip methods but was never satisfied. This make coffee smooth with out any bitter taste or residual that I get with some press methods. If you want a smooth cup of coffee this is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Buy the one with the glass handle.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Chemex for several weeks and I like it a lot. Making coffee this way feels very intentional. There's something Zen about folding the filter, boiling the water and pouring it over the coffee. It's definitely more work than popping in a kcup into a machine. But it feels worth it. Only thing I'm unhappy about is the wooden handle and leather tie. It's too fussy to untie every time you wash it. I see they sell one with a glass handle. I may get that one next. I add extra coffee because it seems weaker when made this way. Overall I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Disney mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for personal servings.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy my coffee and this Chemex helps me enjoy it even more. Pour over coffee is the best! This size is great because you don't have to worry about making to much like you would with the larger sizes. The only negative thing I could say is that the Chemex filters fit in this a bit odd, takes a lot more folding. It's almost like doing origami to get the right size. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Padua

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly smooth coffee
customer_reviews.text: The best coffee I’ve ever had. I bought this for my boyfriend who only drinks coffee as a treat and he was astonished at the dramatic increase in the quality of the same coffee he always drinks. I myself have always hated coffee due to its bitterness but I could drink this coffee every day. It was so smooth, not bitter at all. Amazing! Very easy to clean, the filter is the only thing that gets dirty and you throw that out (compostable) and you just have to rinse the flask and it’s ready to use again.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Coffee tastes good again!
customer_reviews.text: This system has renewed my love of coffee. I love the simplicity of it and the coffee tastes wonderful. So glad I moved past my Keurig and Tassimo stages! No more expensive little plastic cups with stale grounds.
customer_reviews.author: patpaq

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to break
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 2 years and it broke. I love the Chemex brand because it does keep the coffee hot a tiny bit longer but having to be extra careful with it every time you use it becomes ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Vongnaraj

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Went through there of these...just because I couldn't believe that a product this expensive could be so fragile...I love the design..but the slighted tap in the dish rack or sink with crack it. Finally I learned....lol
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Warfield

customer_reviews.title: Read my review.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Chemex pour over to replace one just like it I had for many years because I broke the one I had. I was very disappointed in in the fact that there was no glass lid with this new one. The original one came with a glass lid at the same price as this one. Good thing I saved the lid from the old one. I would like for you to send me the lid that should have been with this one or send me a refund for the difference in the price of the Chemex with the lid and without the lid. Your prompt response would be appreciated. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane brock

customer_reviews.title: Chemex 3 cup pot/ A plus
customer_reviews.text: It makes it possible to make a fine cup of coffee. Have to say the paper filters do their job and lower the acidity that I get from using metal drip filters. Simplicity and efficiency, great product.
customer_reviews.author: eppis1

customer_reviews.title: Delicious coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes a delicious single serving (15 oz. for me) of coffee. Keep your beans fresh, grind fine just before brewing, heat your cup with a little extra hot water to keep the coffee hot when you pour it, and this is coffee as good as it can be- full of flavor but no bitterness. Easy to use and clean. My only complaint is with delivery. Lifted the package off of the floor and heard tinkling inside- knew it was broken during shipping. But Amazon Prime made good, delivering a new one the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Vern W

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, bad company
customer_reviews.text: A bit overpriced and did not include any starter filters so I had to hunt some down before I could use it. Really, for the price they get for a glass jar, they could toss in a couple of filters. Directions were very unclear on which ones to buy. This is the smaller version.
customer_reviews.author: David Vaught

customer_reviews.title: Decent coffee, fragile as you'd expect.
customer_reviews.text: Expect to get about one year of use from this with regular use. I'm a careful person but even I can't prevent it from shattering every 10-12 months or so. I wish glass was a tad thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Roger from New York

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted as we hated heating up plastic drip coffee makers and then throwing ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what we wanted as we hated heating up plastic drip coffee makers and then throwing them into the landfill when they died or the glass container broke. Wanted something very simple and this fit the bill. Like it better than the French press which is more difficult to clean and the screens seem to get messed up after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A better cup of coffee made easier...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my French press at work. Easier to use, easier to clean, and makes a better cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Fokker's Feint

customer_reviews.title: Too Delicate for a Morning's Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: When you're rushing around in the morning, afternoon or really whenever you want to enjoy your cup of java, you shouldn't have to worry about excessive cleanup. This Chemex carafe broke after a few months, provided I was rushing around and knocked it over, and that happens with glass. It's too delicate for me. I'd rather just filter the coffee in a paper filter with a rubber band over it. Maybe that's just me?
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Does its Job
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special, serves its purpose. I'm no coffee connoisseur, but from a utalitarian perspective it gets 4/5. Minus one star because the glass could be of higher quality. It is not tempered glass, so after making your coffee wait for it to cool down before rinsing, as I have no doubts it would crack when exposed to extreme changes to heat/cold too quickly. EDIT: Purchase date was April 24, 2017.. still going strong. I think people just need to be more careful with their own things.
customer_reviews.author: The Critic

customer_reviews.title: classic, little, somewhat pricey (i guess not for a chemex, though)
customer_reviews.text: superior to other pour over hourglass vase looking coffee contraptions. thicker somewhat tempered glass with a classic chemex handle thing. real cute. love it for how much space it doesn't take up on my kitchen counter. it's not the cheapest but i honestly do feel like the materials used in production are of higher quality than other coffee makers of similar design. probably worth it if you like coffee enough to make a good, solid pour over every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Chemex Classic Series, Pour-Over
customer_reviews.text: I like my Chemex Classic Series, Pour-Over but I am going to buy a 6 or 8 cup because the 1 3/4 cups of water filters to slow for me while I am getting ready for work
customer_reviews.author: P M

customer_reviews.title: A Must for all Coffee Lovers
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product twice since I purchased it last week. It's as advertised. Sure, it takes a lot longer to make coffee using a Chemex, and it's certainly not for everyday use, but it brews an amazing cup of coffee and is perfect for small gatherings and a great way to treat family members or guest. True coffee lovers must purchase a Chemex. You just might taste the true flavor of your beans for the fist time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: I filters come w pot like 1 maybe no nothing
customer_reviews.text: Why didn’t to include at least one sample filter jeez not good so cheap
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Harvey P. Simon

customer_reviews.title: It's a chemex perfect for the office
customer_reviews.text: It's a chemex, and that means good coffee. It's a convenient size for a satisfying morning coffee routine at work. I keep mine on a cup warmer so the 2nd cup of coffee is at the perfect temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Moore

customer_reviews.title: Was a gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this one to replace an old one that a friend broke during a move. It is glass, so it is only as durable as any other glass. Think drinking glass not borosilicate. Seems to work exactly as its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Bhosley

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for one person. Definitely would want a bigger one if you wanted multiple cups, but this is perfect for me. The paper filters for this size are hard to find so I found a company that makes reusable cotton filters. No complaints over here!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, fun pot!
customer_reviews.text: Gave the pot as a gift to one of my favorite sisters, who collects coffee pots. It’s amazing how advance the designs are for coffee pots today. Felt good giving her this pot and she loves it! I want one too! 😢
customer_reviews.author: Mama Foody!

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product and great coffee. It takes a little more work than a k cup but definitely worth the work.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for One Person
customer_reviews.text: The glass is a little delicate and grip gets a little too warm but overall we really like our Chemex. I like to use it on the weekend as a way to enjoy a strong cup of gourmet coffee while relaxing. Pros are that it’s a great size for one person to have a large cup of coffee. And it is easy to clean. I recommend this to anyone who is new to manual coffee makers.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H

customer_reviews.title: Good product bad, quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The glass is fine, the wood around the neck was broken. I'm not returning for that small of an issue. But had quality control been better it'd have gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Metheney

customer_reviews.title: We like it
customer_reviews.text: My wife swears by this coffee making method. She really enjoys making coffee with it. It’s not an eye sore to look at either.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Classy
customer_reviews.text: Use it to make coffee with dessert. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Patartsy3

customer_reviews.title: Hard to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee but it is hard to clean. The shape of the bottom does not allow for easy cleaning. I have tried several types and shapes of brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Shortgamer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: I love coffee. This little gem makes me love it even more. Where'd my giant stainless steel coffee maker with timer and built-in grinder go? It's sitting on the top of my fridge. Cuisinart, you had your chance. Get yourself one of these, a Braun coffee grinder, and you'll be all set with the smoothest, finest-tasting coffee you've ever had. Super simple to use, clean, and enjoy. I love my Chemex, and I'm never letting a robot make my coffee again!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Skorik

customer_reviews.title: replacement
customer_reviews.text: Have gone through two 6 cup coffee makers and loved them. The three cup is actually a replacement for one that my wife broke. But I like the three cup as much as the 6 cup.
customer_reviews.author: Walter W. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i was looking for. Lil bit hard to clean. But a bottle brush made it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Gubatan

customer_reviews.title: Makes a satisfying cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many methods for making a good cuppa, and this Chemex coffee maker is the one I've wound up using almost every morning for years. (Of course, you have to start with a halfway decent coffee bean coarsely ground.) Five generous tablespoons of coffee and 15 ounces of off-the-boil water--that's how I do it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to Pour
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend the Chemex 3-Cup because the wooden insulation is simply too small. Pouring a cup without having my fingers touch hot glass is basically impossible. For > $40, I would want this experience to be better. I own a larger version that is perfectly fine. These little 3-cup guys are not the same experience
customer_reviews.author: Claire S

customer_reviews.title: The best “pour over” coffee system!
customer_reviews.text: I love Coffee made in a Chemex glass carafe. You must use their filters to get the great flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Minnis

customer_reviews.title: It makes 15 oz.
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it looks. I love the way it makes just enough for myself and my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Gushue

customer_reviews.title: It made great coffee then and it still does
customer_reviews.text: I had a Chemex as my coffee maker years ago. It made great coffee then and it still does. I got the 3 cup size which I use for myself vs. firing up the 12 cup maker for a cup of coffee. Cone brewers are the better than flat bottom and Glass is better then my automatic maker’s inner workings!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: I tried a knockoff brand but it didn't last a week. This is a beautiful as it is functional. And makes a nice base ina pinch
customer_reviews.author: Clint Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: nice product.
customer_reviews.text: cool little design. It takes about five or so minutes to brew a cup, but it tastes great. Buying this along with the filters you need can get a bit pricey especially if you drink a lot of coffee. Also you have to be careful not to run the wooden handle and leather strap through the dishwasher or else you will ruin it.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: best coffee maker ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the chemex for a few years - I broke my last one and re-orderd immediately ! Easy to use and coffee tastes wonderful - guests who see me using this chemex have ordered their own !
customer_reviews.author: susie b

customer_reviews.title: Decorative and makes good coffee
customer_reviews.text: This works just like described. It is a little bit of a pain to have to fold the filters for this. It also takes a lot of work to make a cup of coffee. I really wanted something to make the whole process simpler and this did not do that. It makes good coffee, but I really can't see that it is any better than my regular drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: LHH

customer_reviews.title: Quality and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it because it was the RIGHT size...works perfectly for my morning coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Treva Lee Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: This glass coffee maker is just the right size for making 1-2 mugs of coffee (3-6 cups). I use it most mornings. The Chemex filters are the easiest to use but I find that if I double up a regular coffee filter, it works almost as good. Makes a great cup of coffee and I like that there is no plastic coming in contact with hot water (most other coffee makers).
customer_reviews.author: RDH

customer_reviews.title: Check the size you're buying!
customer_reviews.text: Love it just thought I had got the bigger one. Wasn't aware there were different sizes but this will do.
customer_reviews.author: Migue Torres

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied! Item(s) order received just as expected. Great business!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Kawahara

customer_reviews.title: I never have a bad cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Ever since switching to the chemex system, I never have a bad cup of coffee. It's a little more work, but so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Wooden cuff broke
customer_reviews.text: Wooden cuff broke after 2nd use. I just tied the leather strap tighter but this was not cheap to buy and I think it should hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my girlfriend because she's usually just making coffee for herself or one other person. This is the perfect size to make excellent coffee for one or two!

customer_reviews.title: I love pour over coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have used one of these everyday for the last 3 yrs. no one makes them like chemex

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I have broken two, so this is my third one. It makes one very big cup of coffee. If you want to make more at a time I would suggest a lager version.

customer_reviews.title: Chemex Classic Series Glass Coffeemaker, 3 cup capacity  - Makes Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Love the coffeemaker and with the Chemex natural filter squares, it makes a great coffee without oily residual taste. Easy to dispose of coffee grounds because they are in the filtered squares --- no mess or fuss. It's perfect for just one large cup of coffee. If you are brewing for 2 or more persons, get the large 6-8 cup capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Delicious coffee - making, w/o electricity.
customer_reviews.text: It's a tastefully designed, ergonomic item for making simple, delicious pour-over coffee. No fuss.

customer_reviews.text: I've never had a better cup of coffee than from this. No bitter taste and super smooth. Will be getting one for every coffee lover I know.

customer_reviews.title: Chemex glass coffeemaker...love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Chemex glass coffeemaker. It works very well for both coffee, and tea. I found too, that it fits into my dishwasher, so that I am able to keep it sparkling clean. The coffee tastes wonderful...nice that there is no "sludge" in the bottom of my cup!
customer_reviews.author: GrammyT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for two cups but that’s it. Purchased it as a gift for my son.

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor; gets the best out of your coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the east of use and the ability to change the flavor by adjusting the grams of coffee and flow rate. You will have fun finding your favorite formulas.

customer_reviews.title: Chemex is still the best
customer_reviews.text: Chemex makes the best coffee. I've played around with everything from french press to drip to cold brewed to toddies, and chemex is definitely the best tasting and easiest. It takes a little bit more time that just dumping grounds and water into a mystery machine and hitting "go," but it's well worth it.

customer_reviews.text: Broke after a couple uses. Was awesome before that but really bad quality. Could not handle hot water which is a problem for a device that makes coffee
customer_reviews.author: Dave Harry

customer_reviews.title: Changes your coffee game!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this Chemex as I can have a quality cup of coffee each morning. I've tried other contraptions such as French press, Keurig, etc, but have found that the Chemex to be best the best in brewing the quality coffee while being easy to clean/use.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time this morning and I am so happy that I chose to buy it. I absolutely love coffee and this just makes coffee even better. My husband who isn't much of a coffee drinker said, "Wow, I might actually start liking coffee." I think that says it all.

customer_reviews.text: i like it, haven't figured out the best way to clean it yet though. works great. keeps the coffee pretty hot while its brewing.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Chemex
customer_reviews.text: This size Chemex works great for single cups. I also have the larger Chemex for making two cups at the same time, but the single size flows much better and makes a better cup of coffee in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: by.way.of.fire

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1 or 2 cups
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Chemex for one person. That is specifically why I ordered it. It is living up to its reputation. The design is attractive, easy to clean and makes yummy coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy R.

customer_reviews.title: For the purest cup of coffee on earth
customer_reviews.text: Coffee made with the Chemex is some of the best coffee I've ever had. I bought the Chemex because a co-worker used it and I thought it would be easier than a French press to clean at work. I didn't expect that the quality of the coffee would be enhanced by the unique design. I would totally recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Experience Ever
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit it, I'm a coffee snob. I like for coffee to be an experience. Grinding the coffee beans, heating up the carafe, boiling the water and pouring it over the beans... Over great conversation, the fresh coffee aromas and coffee dripping make a wonderful experience. Then pouring the coffee and savoring it. No bitterness, just great, full bodied coffee. I definitely recommend the Chemex for brewing your best coffees.
